API Collection# Collection Implementations

## [Topics](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/collection-implementations#topics)

### [Instance Properties](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/collection-implementations#Instance-Properties)

[`var count: Int`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/count)The number of elements in the collection.[`var endIndex: Substring.UTF16View.Index`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/endindex)The collection’s “past the end” position—that is, the position one greater than the last valid subscript argument.[`var first: Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/first)The first element of the collection.[`var isEmpty: Bool`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/isempty)A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.[`var startIndex: Substring.UTF16View.Index`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/startindex)The position of the first element in a nonempty collection.[`var underestimatedCount: Int`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/underestimatedcount)A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.### [Instance Methods](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/collection-implementations#Instance-Methods)

[`func drop(while: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/drop(while:))Returns a subsequence by skipping elements while `predicate` returns `true` and returning the remaining elements.[`func dropFirst(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/dropfirst(_:))Returns a subsequence containing all but the given number of initial elements.[`func firstIndex(of: Self.Element) -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/firstindex(of:))Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.[`func firstIndex(where: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/firstindex(where:))Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies the given predicate.[`func formIndex(inout Self.Index, offsetBy: Int)`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/formindex(_:offsetby:))Offsets the given index by the specified distance.[`func formIndex(inout Self.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: Self.Index) -> Bool`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/formindex(_:offsetby:limitedby:))Offsets the given index by the specified distance, or so that it equals the given limiting index.[`func index(of: Self.Element) -> Self.Index?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/index(of:))Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.[`func indices(of: Self.Element) -> RangeSet<Self.Index>`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/indices(of:))Returns the indices of all the elements that are equal to the given element.[`func indices(where: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> RangeSet<Self.Index>`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/indices(where:))Returns the indices of all the elements that match the given predicate.[`func makeIterator() -> IndexingIterator<Self>`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/makeiterator())Returns an iterator over the elements of the collection.[`func map<T, E>((Self.Element) throws(E) -> T) throws(E) -> [T]`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/map(_:)-2jwvg)Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure over the sequence’s elements.[`func popFirst() -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/popfirst())Removes and returns the first element of the collection.[`func prefix(Int) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/prefix(_:))Returns a subsequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing the initial elements of the collection.[`func prefix(through: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/prefix(through:))Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the specified position.[`func prefix(upTo: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/prefix(upto:))Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not including, the specified position.[`func prefix(while: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/prefix(while:))Returns a subsequence containing the initial elements until `predicate` returns `false` and skipping the remaining elements.[`func randomElement() -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/randomelement())Returns a random element of the collection.[`func randomElement<T>(using: inout T) -> Self.Element?`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/randomelement(using:))Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as a source for randomness.[`func removeFirst() -> Self.Element`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/removefirst())Removes and returns the first element of the collection.[`func removeFirst(Int)`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/removefirst(_:))Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.[`func removingSubranges(RangeSet<Self.Index>) -> DiscontiguousSlice<Self>`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/removingsubranges(_:))Returns a collection of the elements in this collection that are not represented by the given range set.[`func split(maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool, whereSeparator: (Self.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> [Self.SubSequence]`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/split(maxsplits:omittingemptysubsequences:whereseparator:))Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.[`func split(separator: Self.Element, maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool) -> [Self.SubSequence]`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/split(separator:maxsplits:omittingemptysubsequences:))Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, around elements equal to the given element.[`func suffix(from: Self.Index) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/suffix(from:))Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the collection.### [Subscripts](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/collection-implementations#Subscripts)

[`subscript<R>(R) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/subscript(_:)-2ljg7)Accesses the contiguous subrange of the collection’s elements specified by a range expression.[`subscript(RangeSet<Self.Index>) -> DiscontiguousSlice<Self>`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/subscript(_:)-3ijoy)Accesses a view of this collection with the elements at the given indices.[`subscript((UnboundedRange_) -> ()) -> Self.SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/subscript(_:)-5j3ao)[`subscript(Substring.UTF16View.Index) -> Substring.UTF16View.Element`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/subscript(_:)-ketw)Accesses the element at the specified position.### [Type Aliases](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/collection-implementations#Type-Aliases)

[`typealias Index`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/index)A type that represents a position in the collection.[`typealias Indices`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/indices-swift.typealias)A type that represents the indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.[`typealias Iterator`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/iterator)A type that provides the collection’s iteration interface and encapsulates its iteration state.[`typealias SubSequence`](/documentation/swift/substring/utf16view/subsequence)A collection representing a contiguous subrange of this collection’s elements. The subsequence shares indices with the original collection.
